Package Collecto

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Collecto.Player
  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a player of the game, it stores the name of the player and tracks all the balls which have been earned while playing a game. It is used by the Game class by storing two Players who are playing that game.
    See Also:
    Game, Ball

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Player​(java.lang.String name)
      Constructs a Player instance with the specified name.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addBalls​(java.util.ArrayList<Ball> ballsArray)
      Adds all ball colours except for WHITE in a specified array to balls of this Player.
      int getBallAmount()
      Returns the total amount of balls that this player currently has.
      java.util.HashMap<Ball,​java.lang.Integer> getBalls()
      Returns a HashMap of the different colour balls this player has obtained and the corresponding amount of that colour ball that this player has acquired.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of this player.
      int getPoints()
      Returns calculated total point for this Player, where 3 points are awarded for every 3 balls of the same colour that this Player has acquired.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public int getPoints()
        Returns calculated total point for this Player, where 3 points are awarded for every 3 balls of the same colour that this Player has acquired.
        Returns:
        total points for this player
